That's not true actually. I think you are down playing just how big a 42 heal is (especially in the early game.) It's the same reason why people get so frustrated with lane Kindred even though their heal is - only - 60 + 3 x their level. It is a reliable way to stay in lane and win extended trades at no cost to the player.

Because of how yasuo's crit chance functions, while it is still relatively speaking, more rng early game, it turns out to be a reliable way to sustain. I'd wager he could actually out heal kindred in lane after this patch. With two otems (statik + cloqk og agility) he hits 100% crit chance. That means on literally everything he does, he gets that heal as well as having an INCREDIBLY flexible build path since he only has to worry about two item slots for crits.

Comparing the crit mastery to the on hit bonus damage, the crit mastery seems a bit weak in comparison.

It gives 80 bonus damage on every Q and auto, unreducted and can be stacked up using any ability. I would rather take that than extra lifesteal since I can just build lifesteal.

Well, that is the point of the new masteries. It is supposed to give you choices based on your preference as a player.

I will note, that the crit mastery opens up toms of build paths for yasuo / trynd, because it removes the need to eorry about sustain since that is baked into their masteries. The problem with the other option is that it forces you to stay in combat and needs to ramp up. I like it for kog, but I don't believe that is worth sacrificing the sustain without the need for lifesteal
The reason he got downvoted wasn't because he presented actual numbers.

42 heal is a LOT for early game sustain. That's close to a third of a health pot.

Think about it this way, even if he has 840 health, 42 heal for a crit is 5% of his max health.

300 damage is assuming a crit with at least... 150ish? 180 ish? AD. Meaning he probably has everything to build the IE but no IE.

I would call that mid game. Early game its usually 100-150 ish damage, so half that heal. Maybe even 1/3.
